CHANGES TO THIS POLICY X.HOW TO REACH US We're taking a different approach to privacy Show Me Privacy Policy Effective Date: January 1, 2023 Teacher Synergy LLC d/b/a Teachers Pay Teachers (referred to in this policy as “Teachers Pay Teachers”, “TPT”, “us”, “we”, or “our”) has adopted the following Privacy Policy to explain how we collect, use, and share information from and about you in connection with certain of our products, services, and properties. Your privacy and security are very important to us at TPT. We’re committed to transparency when it comes to our privacy practices and how we safeguard your information. This Privacy Policy (“Policy”) outlines what kinds of information we may collect from and about you as you visit or use TPT, how that information may be used and shared, and what rights and choices you may have. This Policy applies to any use of our “Services” which includes our website at TeachersPayTeachers.com and any affiliated web pages or forms we may create or host (collectively our “Site”), our mobile applications (“Apps”), or when you communicate with us. By using or accessing the Services in any manner, you acknowledge that you accept the practices and policies outlined in this Policy, and you hereby consent to our collection, use, and sharing of your information in the following ways. This Policy is part of our Terms of Service which you can find here . Any terms we use in this Policy without defining them have the definitions given to them in the Terms of Service. You may find a printable PDF copy of this Policy by clicking here . If you require an alternative format to access this policy due to a disability, please contact us at Support@TeachersPayTeachers.com for assistance. If you are looking for information about how we process and protect Student Data in connection with the use of Student Tools like Easel by TPT, please visit our dedicated Student Privacy Policy . I. PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT Some information we collect in connection with our Services is considered “Personal Information” (or PI). Personal Information means information that relates to and can be used to identify you personally and includes things like your full name, street address, phone number, email address, and also includes information referred to as “personally identifiable information”, “personal information” and “personal data” under applicable data privacy laws, rules, or regulations. Other than as provided for in this Policy, we won’t share or disclose Personal Information without your consent. Sometimes Personal Information may be aggregated or de-identified to remove the ability to link that data to an identifiable person and such data will no longer be considered Personal Information. De-identified, aggregated and other non-personal information and may be retained, used, and disclosed in accordance with applicable privacy laws. 1. SOURCES OF PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT A. You, For Information You Make Available to Us Visitors. When you use our Services as a Visitor, we may ask for information about your preferences and interests to personalize your experience and help you find what you need. All Members. To use many aspects of our Services, you’re required to create a TPT Account and become a Member. To become a Member, we require that you pick a unique username, and provide us with your email address so we can contact you. We may also ask you to tell us your name so we know who you are. We may ask you to share some information about what kind of user you are (your role), your geographic location, what and where you teach, and information about your interests to help us personalize your experience using our Services. Finally, some features of our Service may allow you to upload, create, record, post or otherwise add and/or share Resources or other content (“Content”) through our platform. Sellers. Members who register for one of our Seller Memberships (“Sellers”), will be required to provide additional contact information and set up or connect a payout account to receive Earnings. Sellers can choose to use a name other than their given name as a “Store Name.” A Seller’s Store Name, profile image or logo, and any additional information they choose to provide about themselves in their Store profile will be publicly viewable. To comply with applicable laws, we may collect federal tax identification information from Sellers, including your social security number or employer identification number, to verify your identity and issue tax documents. Purchase information . When you make a purchase through our Services, you’ll need to provide billing and payment information to complete your order. We’ve carefully chosen Service Providers who use Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) compliant practices to process payments (“Payment Processors”). Whether you check out using a credit or debit card, PayPal account, or any other payment method we may support, your payment will be processed directly by our Payment Processor and we’ll never have access to or store your full payment card details. When you use a credit or debit card to pay for your purchases, you’ll be asked to add a credit or debit card payment source (“Payment Card”). When you submit your order, this information will be sent directly to and stored by our Payment Processor. After your payment is processed, the Payment Processor will send TPT some details about the transaction so that we can record your order in our database and provide access to the materials that you purchased. The Payment Card you added will be available for future use on your Account. You can edit or remove this information at any time by navigating to the checkout page or by contacting us for assistance. B. You, For Information Collected Automatically In Connection With Your Use of Our Services When you use our Services as a Member or a Visitor, we receive and collect certain information from your browser and your device such as your Internet Protocol address (IP address), device information, operating system, browser type and version, and browser country location. This information helps us defend against fraudulent activity or attacks, maintain the security of our Services, and improve and personalize your experience. We also log data related to how Members and Visitors use our Services, including Cookies (as defined below) that may uniquely identify your visit or account. This log data includes details such as what pages of our Site or App you visit and when, how users navigate through the Site, and visit referral URLs. This information allows us to better understand how our Services are being used, helps us make improvements, and enables us to personalize your experience with our Services. (Please refer to the Cookies section below for more information about how we use Cookies.) From time to time, we may host and provide Members and Visitors the opportunity to participate in contests, sweepstakes, and surveys. If you choose to participate, you may be asked to provide Personal Information which may be used for purposes necessary to administer the contest, sweepstakes, or survey, or for other marketing purposes. C. Third Parties General. We may collect information about you from third parties as permitted by law or through your interaction with third parties we may integrate with from time to time to offer new features and/or services to you (“Third Party Integrations”). We may also receive information about you from third parties such as other Members in connection with our provision of certain services, including for example TPT School Access or gift cards, as well as from some of our service providers who assist us with marketing or promotional services related to how you interact with our websites, applications, products, services, advertisements or communications. Integrations. Third Party Integrations may for example, include your use of certain features allowing you to import or export content to or from TPT or linking an account you have with Google or a supported LMS to TPT. TPT may add or remove Third Party Integrations from time to time. Your use of Third Party Integrations is at your discretion and risk and subject to the Third Party Integration’s terms and privacy policies. Google Drive - Through an integration with Google Drive, you may have the option to list files directly from your Google Drive in your TPT store (“Resources for Google Apps”), or access Resources for Google Apps directly through your Google Drive account (e.g. resources that you have purchased or added to your TPT account for free). To enable your use of this integration, you’ll need to give TPT permission to access your Google Drive for the purposes described in this section. If you’re a Seller listing Resources from your Google Drive, we’ll use this access to list in your TPT store files that you choose from your Google Drive account, set file permissions, make copies for each Member who purchases or accesses your Resources for Google Apps for free, and monitor listed files from your Google Drive for deletions, updates, or changes in permissions so we may be able to alert you or impacted Members. For Members who choose to purchase (or access for free) Resources for Google Apps, we’ll use this access to deliver the Resource to your Google Drive. Use of the integration is subject to Google’s privacy policies — you can find more information about how Google uses your information and what information Google shares with us here . Learning Management Services - you (or your School) may be able to connect to third party Learning Management Services. See our Student Privacy Policy for more detailed information on what information may be collected or shared when using these integrations. External Payment Accounts. If you choose to pay for a purchase using an external account like PayPal or ApplePay, you’ll directly access that account to complete your order and when it’s complete, they’ll send us a confirmation with transaction details so we can record your order and provide access to the Resources or services you’ve purchased. We do not collect information about or have access to the specific payment or funding sources or any other financial account details associated with your PayPal, ApplePay or other similar external accounts. II. HOW WE MAY SHARE PERSONAL INFORMATION We disclose your Personal Information to the following categories of third parties including service providers, contractors and other parties: 1. Sellers, When You Place an Order When you place an order on TPT, you’re purchasing from a Seller Member with whom we’ll share order details including what you purchased and your name, city, state, and zip code. 2. The Public or Other Members, When You Connect, Share, or Communicate With Them There may be features of our Services which allow you to: Post, create, upload, record or otherwise add Content (e.g. Resources you publish, Communications such as comments, reviews, questions, or other public or private messages, and materials or media created by use of certain features in Easel such as audio or video recordings) Connect, communicate, and share information with other Members (such as Resource Collections, Member to Member messages, Q&A, and so on) Join and post messages in forums, groups, or communities Join or link your account to another Member (e.g. to login as a VA with Support Access), to an Organization using TPT for Schools or TPT School Access (together “School Account”), or other Services that allow similar account connections Submit requests for Resources or participate in a shared wish list Display a public profile (e.g. by joining as Seller and having a storefront on TPT), and so on By using any of these features, you’re choosing to share information about yourself and/or your TPT account and/or activity with TPT, and you’re directing TPT to make that information available to the public, other Members, and/or your School or Organization as the case may be. To the extent TPT enables Members to send messages directly to other Members, TPT’s Community Guidelines policy applies and TPT may moderate such communications as we deem necessary to enforce our policies and keep TPT a safe place to transact. When you use TPT as a member of a School Account, information about your membership with that School Account is accessible to other members of your School Account and your use of and information related to that School Account will be managed by the School Account administrator. If you link your account for Support Access, please review our VA Login Terms and Conditions for more detail on what information may be shared. If you are a Seller, information from your “Store Profile” section of your Account will be visible to all visitors and Members who visit your store page – this includes your store name (which will be your first and last name unless you choose a different Store Name, any information you add to your Store Profile about your experience, education, and certifications, bio, teaching style and so on). 3. Service Providers & Contractors TPT engages the services of third party companies and contractors (“Service Providers”) to support and help provide certain features of our Services such as, but not limited to, payment processing, hosting, customer support, data storage and analysis, monitoring Site traffic and activity, usability testing and research, error reporting and debugging, communication and content delivery, business operations, advertising, surveys, security and fraud prevention, staff augmentation, and other services. TPT shares data with these Service Providers so that they can perform their services which help deliver our Services more securely, efficiently, and effectively. Service Providers may have access to certain Personal Information in the course of providing their service. Service Providers’ access to your Personal Information is limited to the purpose of providing their services in accordance with an agreement with TPT. Service Providers are not permitted to disclose Personal Information they may process on our behalf to other parties (other than their own service providers as necessary) or use your Personal Information for any other purpose. TPT may, from time to time, share aggregate or de-identified user data with business partners, Service Providers, or other third parties to identify or share trends, usage statistics, and so on. 4. Third Parties, In Connection With a Merger, Acquisition, or Other Change of Control As part of a merger, acquisition, bankruptcy or other transaction in which a third party assumes control of our business (in whole or in part), we may transfer the data we have collected, including Personal Information, to the third party. In such an event, we’ll notify you of that change. In addition, any purchasing company would have to abide by the terms of this Policy including notifying you before making material changes and giving you the opportunity to opt out. 5. Third Parties, For Information Requests and Legal Obligations To the extent you make purchases through the Services using an institution, school, or other third-party entity’s credit or debit card, PayPal account, or any other payment method, and that institution, school, or third party requests such information or information related thereto and TPT, in its sole discretion, determines such request is reasonable, we may choose to provide such information or information related thereto to that institution, school, or third party. Finally, we respect and comply with legal obligations and may release information (including Personal Information and information about your account activities) in cooperation with a law enforcement investigation, in response to a valid legal request such as a court order, legal subpoena, or government inquiry or audit, as part of the process outlined by the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA), or to defend, protect, or exercise our legal rights. 6. Other Third Parties, At Your Direction. We may share your Personal Information with other third parties as authorized, directed or requested by you. From time to time, we may provide access to Third Party Integrations or otherwise partner with third party companies or organizations including advertisers to provide additional services, products, and offers (collectively “Partners” and “Partner Services”). When you choose to engage with Partners or use Partner Services, you direct TPT to share Personal Information for the purposes of facilitating your use of the Partner Services and the Partner may collect information from you directly by your interaction. When you choose to engage with Partner Services or authorize TPT to share your Personal Information with a third party other than a Service Provider, you understand that Partners and other such third parties are independent of TPT and this Privacy Policy does not apply to such third party’s collection, use, and sharing practices. You may want to review each such third party’s own privacy notices prior to engaging with them for information on how such third parties will process your information. III. OUR COMMITMENT TO CHILDREN’S PRIVACY At TPT, we take children’s privacy very seriously. TPT’s Terms of Service require all account holders to be at least 18 years old. Except as otherwise set forth in this section, we do not knowingly collect Personal Information from children under the age of 13. If you are under 13, you should not use or attempt to use our Services except to complete assignments in Easel by TPT at the direction of your teacher and you should not send any information about yourself to TPT. Except with respect to Student Tools, if we discover that we have collected information from a child under the age of 13, we will take the appropriate measures to promptly remove that information from our Services. To the extent that you use the Student Tools such as Easel by TPT, please visit our dedicated Student Privacy Policy to learn more about how we treat the information we collect in connection with the Student Tools, which may include information about children who are under the age of 13. If you believe that TPT may have collected Personal Information about a child under 13 other than through use of our Student Tools, please contact us at support@teacherspayteachers.com to let us know. We’ll work with you to make sure that information is removed from our Site. IV. DATA SECURITY AND RETENTION 1. DATA SECURITY We seek to protect your Personal Information from unauthorized access, use and disclosure using appropriate physical, technical, organizational and administrative security measures based on the type of Personal Information and how we are processing that data. You can help keep your account secure by appropriately selecting and protecting your password and/or other sign-on mechanism; limiting access to your computer or device and browser; and signing off after you have finished accessing your account. Although we work to protect the security of your account and other data that we hold in our records, please be aware that no method of transmitting data over the internet or storing data is completely secure. We cannot guarantee the complete security of any data you share with us, and except as expressly required by law, we are not responsible for the theft, destruction, loss, or inadvertent disclosure of your information or content. 2. ACCOUNT SECURITY Access to your TPT Account is secured by the password you choose. For your security, we store only a hashed version of your password. This means that we don’t know your password and your password isn’t visible to us when members of our team view your Account for example to provide you with support. To prevent unauthorized access to your Account, choose a password that can’t be easily guessed and don’t share your password with anyone else. Whenever you use a shared computer or other shared device to access your TPT Account (for example, a school computer), be sure to log out of your Account completely before you leave your workstation, uncheck the “remember me” option at login, and select “no” if the web browser prompts you to save your login credentials. You’re responsible for keeping your password confidential, and for all activity that occurs under your TPT Account, whether or not authorized by you. You can change or update your password anytime by visiting your My Account page. If you forget your password, you can use the “Forgot Password” feature to get a reset password link emailed to you. 3. DATA RETENTION TPT will use your information for the reasons detailed in this Policy in order to deliver our Services to you. You can deactivate or permanently close your account with us at any time. If you deactivate your account, your account is placed in an inactive state but remains intact and you may reactivate it by logging back in with your username or email and password at any time. If you deactivate your account, we’ll no longer send you marketing or other email communications. To find instructions for how to deactivate your account, see our FAQ here . You can close your account permanently by writing in a request to our support team. We will retain your information as long as you have a TPT account that has not been permanently closed and for some time thereafter as needed and in accordance with applicable law and industry best practices. For example, financial records often must be kept for a minimum of 7 years, if you’re a Buyer, we may retain certain information to provide sales data to Sellers you’ve transacted with and for sales tax purposes, and, if you’re a Seller, we retain certain data and content to continue to make Resources available to Members who have purchased from you. We may also retain certain information, to comply with a valid legal request or resolve a dispute, or to meet any legal requirements or obligations. We may also continue to include your data as part of ongoing data and usage analysis on an aggregated and/or de-identified basis. We may dispose of Personal Information sooner if subject to a verifiable request for erasure under applicable law. V. YOUR RIGHTS AND OPTIONS At TPT, it’s important to us that you have the ability to make choices about your personal information, so we provide you with options for managing your account and the information you give us. For jurisdiction specific rights, see Section VIII. 1. ACCOUNT INFORMATION You can view, update, and correct the information you’ve provided about yourself by visiting your My Account page. You can also remove any of the optional information you’ve provided. Information that is required will be indicated as such and can be updated but cannot be removed. If you don’t want to have an account with us anymore, you can close your account at any time. You can find instructions on how to close your account here, or you can contact us for assistance. 2. SAVED PAYMENT SOURCE Your saved Payment Card record can be edited or deleted from the checkout page. If you need assistance, you can contact us and we’ll be happy to remove any saved Payment Card records for you. 3. EMAIL PREFERENCES TPT uses your contact information to communicate with you about our services and to provide notifications related to your account or activity. Certain communications related to your account or your activity are required and you can’t opt out of receiving them. These include, but aren’t limited to, purchase-related notifications, notifications related to changes that have been made to your login credentials or account details, and legal notifications. Other communications may not be required such as announcements about our Services, newsletters and messages with information you might be interested in, and other marketing and promotional messages (“Optional Communications”). You can manage your preferences related to Optional Communications in the Email Preferences section of your account, or by using the “unsubscribe” link at the bottom of any Optional Communication you receive. 4. YOUR CONTENT If you choose to create a public profile, upload Resources or post Communications or use other features that enable you to share content with others, any information you post may be visible by other Members and the public. You may be able to edit or remove certain content you’ve posted or manage the sharing settings. VI. HOSTED CONTENT, ADS AND LINKS TO THIRD PARTY WEBSITES Our Services contain content from third parties including content posted or uploaded by Members such as Resources and third party offers/ads (“Third Party Content”). Third Party Content may contain links where you can access websites and/or content owned and operated by third parties. The terms of this Policy apply only to our Services and websites and do not apply to any third party websites or services that may be linked to, integrated with, or accessible from our Services. We can’t guarantee the privacy and security standards of other websites or services, so if you choose to engage with third party content, you’ll want to familiarize yourself with the privacy policies and other terms applicable to those providers. Communications and Resources are posted or uploaded to our Services by and made available at the direction of our Members. We are not responsible for the contents of Communications or Resources, including any disclosures of Personal Information therein by our Members. If you believe that any Content posted on our Services violates your personal privacy rights, please notify us using the “Report This Resource” tool available from every product listing or contact us using the contact information provided below. VII. COOKIES, INTEREST-BASED ADVERTISEMENTS, AND GOOGLE ANALYTICS 1. COOKIES We use cookies and similar technologies such as pixel tags and web beacons (collectively, “Cookies”) to enable us to recognize your device or browser. Cookies are small pieces of data — usually text files — that are stored in the browser of your computer, tablet, phone, or similar device when you use that device to visit our Services and are used to allow you to pick up where you left off, tailor your experience, surface relevant information, products, and advertisements, and provide us with helpful information to monitor traffic and performance, debug errors, and make improvements. We may also supplement the information we collect from you with information received from third parties, including third parties that have placed their own Cookies on your device(s). By using our Services as a Visitor or Member, you agree to our use of Cookies in the following ways, as well as other similar purposes: Analytics Marketing and advertising Preserving your preferences Personalizing your experience Understanding our website traffic and performance To ensure the security and availability of our Site and our Services You have the right to decide whether a website can store Cookies on your computer. Depending on the internet browser you use, you may be able to view, manage, delete, and disable Cookies through your browser preferences. If you choose to delete Cookies or to not allow us to use Cookies, some features may not work properly and you may have to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit a site. To learn more about how to do this, check out instructions from these browsers: Google Chrome Internet Explorer Safari Firefox To find out more information about Cookies, including information about how to manage and delete Cookies, please visit http://www.allaboutcookies.org/. The following types of Cookies are used in connection with our Services: Essential Cookies : Essential Cookies are required for providing you with features or services that you have requested. For example, certain Cookies enable you to log into secure areas of our Services. Disabling these Cookies may make certain features and services unavailable. Functional Cookies : Functional Cookies are used to record your choices and settings regarding our Services, maintain your preferences over time and recognize you when you return to our Services. These cookies help us to personalize our content for you, greet you by name, and remember your preferences. Performance/Analytical Cookies : Performance/Analytical Cookies allow us to understand how visitors use our Services such as by collecting information about the number of visitors to the Services, pageviews and other details about your session. Performance/Analytical Cookies also help us measure the performance of our Services and marketing campaigns in order to help us improve. To support and enhance the Services, we use third-party analytics services, including those provided by Google Inc. (“Google”) and Heap Inc. (“Heap”). Google uses cookies in connection with its Google Analytics services. Google’s ability to use and share information collected by Google Analytics about your visits to the Services is subject to the Google Analytics Terms of Use and the Google Privacy Policy. You have the option to opt-out of Google’s use of cookies by visiting the Google advertising opt-out page at www.google.com/privacy_ads.html or the Google Analytics Opt-out browser Add-on at https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout/ . If you would like more information on the type of information Heap collects, please visit Heap’s Website Terms of Use at https://heap.io/terms . Advertising Cookies : Advertising Cookies collect data about your online activity and interests in order to display advertising relevant to you. For more information about this, please see the section below titled “Information about Interest-Based Advertisements.” This may include cookies set for advertising by TPT as well as by third parties. 2. INFORMATION ABOUT INTEREST-BASED ADVERTISEMENTS In some cases, you may see advertisements about our Services on other websites or services which may be targeted to users who have visited our Site or used our Services or who fit certain general profile categories or display certain preferences or behaviors, or you may see offers from third parties when using our Services (“Interest-Based Ads”). With respect to these Interest-Based Ads, we comply with the Digital Advertising Alliance (“DAA”) Self-Regulatory Principles for Online Behavioral Advertising. Through the DAA and Network Advertising Initiative (“NAI”), several media and marketing associations have developed an industry self-regulatory program to give consumers a better understanding of, and greater control over, ads that are customized based on a consumer’s online behavior across different websites and properties. To make choices about Interest-Based Ads from participating third parties, including to opt-out of receiving behaviorally targeted advertisements from participating organizations, please visit the DAA’s or NAI’s consumer opt-out pages, which are located at http://www.networkadvertising.org/choices/ or www.aboutads.info/choices. 3. GOOGLE ANALYTICS We use Google Analytics to understand and analyze browsing activity, and for advertising through their AdWords and Remarketing Lists features. Google Analytics may store cookies on your device when you use or access our Services and may use those cookies to display advertisements for our products or Services when you visit other websites. You can find out more about this by reading the information Google provides in this explanation: How Google uses data when you use our partners’ sites or apps . If you don’t want Google Analytics to use cookies when you browse, you can install the Google Analytics Opt-Out Browser Add-On to prevent Google Analytics from placing cookies on your browser. You can find out more about this option and how to install the Add-On here . VIII. STATE SPECIFIC NOTICES & RIGHTS 1. CALIFORNIA RESIDENTS If you are a California resident, you have the rights outlined in this section. Please see the “Exercising Your Rights” section below for instructions regarding how to exercise these rights. If there are any conflicts between this section and any other provision of this Policy and you are a California resident, the portion that is more protective of Personal Information shall control to the extent of such conflict. If you have any questions about this section or whether any of the following applies to you, please contact us at Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com . Business Purposes for Disclosing Personal Information Over the past twelve months, we have disclosed the categories of Personal Information listed in the tables in Section I.1(A-G) above to Service Providers or other parties for the following business purposes: To perform auditing related to a current interaction and concurrent transactions To detect security incidents, to protect against malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity, and to prosecute those responsible for that activity To debug including to identify and repair errors that impair existing intended functionality To make short-term, transient use of Personal Information that is not used by another party to build a consumer profile or otherwise alter your consumer experience outside the current interaction To perform services on our behalf, including maintaining or servicing accounts, providing customer service, processing or fulfilling order and transactions, verifying customer information, processing payments, providing advertising or marketing services, providing analytic services, or providing similar services on behalf of the business or service provider To undertake internal research for technological development and demonstration To undertake activities to verify or maintain the quality and safety of our Services Your Rights to Manage and Control Your Personal Information You have the right to request to know what Personal Information has been collected about you, and to access that information. We may limit the disclosure of any Sensitive Information for your security and safety in accordance with the law. You also have the right to request deletion of your Personal Information. Under the CCPA, the right to deletion is subject to certain exceptions: for example, we may need to retain certain Personal Information to provide you with the Services or complete a transaction or other action you have requested, or to comply with our legal obligations. If your deletion request is subject to one of these exceptions, we may deny or partially deny your deletion request. Starting January 1, 2023, you have the right to request correction of any inaccuracies in your Personal Information (to the extent you are unable to make corrections directly via your account), and to request restricted processing of Sensitive Personal Information subject to the exceptions and limitations of the CCPA including for example processing of Sensitive Personal Information that may be necessary or required to meet legal or tax obligations or to provide the Services you’ve requested. Exercising Your Rights To exercise the rights described above, you must send us a request that (1) provides sufficient information to allow us to verify that you are the person about whom we have collected Personal Information, and (2) describes your request in sufficient detail to allow us to understand, evaluate and respond to it. Each request that meets both of these criteria will be considered a “Valid Request.” We may not respond to requests that do not meet these criteria. We will only use Personal Information provided in a Valid Request to verify you and complete your request. We will work to respond to your Valid Request within 45 days of receipt. We will not charge you a fee for making a Valid Request unless your Valid Request(s) is excessive, repetitive, or manifestly unfounded. If we determine that your Valid Request warrants a fee, we will notify you of the fee and explain that decision before completing your request. You may submit a Valid Request using the following methods: Use the self-service online form. Click the “Make a Privacy Request” button at the top of this page to make a self-serve request. You’ll be asked to select what kind of user you are, what kind of request you wish you make. You’ll then enter your email to receive a validation link to validate and confirm your request. Email us at: Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com You may also authorize an agent (an “Authorized Agent”) to exercise your rights on your behalf. To do this, you must provide your Authorized Agent with written permission to do so, and we may request a copy of this written permission from your Authorized Agent when they make a request to exercise your rights on your behalf. Sales and Sharing of Personal Information We will not sell your Personal Information and have not done so over the past twelve months. As of January 1, 2023, you have the right to opt out of the sharing of your Personal Information for targeted behavioral advertising purposes which you can initiate through accessing the link on our homepage titled “Do not share or sell my personal info” (which will be available as of January 1, 2023). We will also honor opt out preferences received via a valid global privacy browser signal. TPT does not knowingly share or sell the information of individuals under the age of 16. Your browser may offer you a “Do Not Track” option, which allows you to signal to operators of websites and web applications and services that you do not wish such operators to track certain of your online activities over time and across different websites. Our Services do not support Do Not Track requests at this time. To find out more about “Do Not Track,” you can visit www.allaboutdnt.com . Non-discrimination We will not discriminate against you for exercising your rights under the CCPA. We will not deny you our goods or services, charge you different prices or rates, or provide you a lower quality of goods and services if you exercise your rights under the CCPA. However, we may offer different tiers of our Services as allowed by applicable data privacy laws (including the CCPA) with varying prices, rates, or levels of quality of the goods or services you receive related to the value of Personal Information that we receive from you. Job Applicants As a California resident applying for employment, you have the right to notice about what information we collect and process about you as a job applicant. Please find our privacy notice detailing what information we collect and process about job applicants here . 2. VIRGINIA RESIDENTS Starting January 1, 2023, under the Virginia Consumer Data Privacy Act (“VCDPA”), Virginia residents have certain additional privacy rights regarding the collection, use and sharing of Personal Information. Section I.1(A-G) of this Policy serves as notice of the categories of Personal Information we may collect about you and our processing purposes and Sections II provides detail about how we may disclose your Personal Information to others such as Service Providers. Your Rights to Manage and Control Your Personal Information TPT doesn’t sell personal information of Virginia residents and hasn’t done so in the last 12 months.As of January 1, 2022 you can do so by using the “Do not share or sell my personal information” link in the homepage footer or by signaling you opt out via a valid global privacy browser signal. If you’re having trouble, reach out to Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com . As of January 1, 2023, you have the right to request access to or deletion of your Personal Information, or to make corrections to inaccuracies. You can initiate a request by clicking the “Make a Privacy Request” button at the top of this page or by emailing us at Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com. We may limit the disclosure of certain information in an access for your security and safety in accordance with the law and the right to deletion is subject to certain exceptions: for example, we may need to retain certain Personal Information to provide you with the Services or complete a transaction or other action you have requested, or to comply with our legal obligation. Appeals may be made by writing to Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com using the subject line: “DSR Appeal.” 3. NEVADA RESIDENTS If you are a resident of Nevada, you have the right to opt out of the sale of certain Personal Information to third parties who intend to license or sell that Personal Information. Please note that we do not currently sell your Personal Information as sales are defined in Nevada Revised Statutes Chapter 603A. You can indicate your preferences with respect to this right by contacting us at Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com with the subject line “Nevada Do Not Sell Request” and providing us with your name and the email address associated with your account. 4. COLORADO RESIDENTS (Effective July 1, 2023) Beginning July 1, 2023, under the Colorado Privacy Act, Colorado residents have additional privacy rights regarding the collections, use and disclosure of their Personal Information. Section I.1(A-G) describes the categories of data, processing purposes, and categories of third parties to whom Personal Information may be disclosed. We do not sell Personal Information of Colorado residents and we do not process Personal Information for purposes of profiling in furtherance of decisions that produce legal or similarly significant effects. Your Rights to Manage and Control Your Personal Information Beginning July 1, 2023, you have the right to opt out of the processing of your Personal Information for purposes of targeted advertising. The opt out mechanism will be made available as of the effective date. Beginning July 1, 2023, you have the right to request access to or deletion of your Personal Information, or to make corrections to inaccuracies. You can initiate a request for deletion or access by clicking the “Make a Privacy Request” button at the top of this page or by emailing us at Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com . We may verify your identity through email verification or by other methods as appropriate. You can submit requests regarding inaccuracies by emailing Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com . We may limit the disclosure of certain information in an access for your security and safety in accordance with the law and the right to deletion is subject to certain exceptions: for example, we may need to retain certain Personal Information to provide you with the Services or complete a transaction or other action you have requested, or to comply with our legal obligation. You may also authorize an agent (an “Authorized Agent”) to exercise your rights on your behalf. To do this, you must provide your Authorized Agent with written permission to do so, and we may request a copy of this written permission from your Authorized Agent when they make a request to exercise your rights on your behalf. You have the right to appeal a decision to deny processing of a request by emailing Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com using the subject line: “DSR Appeal'', and you have the ability to contact the Colorado Attorney General if you have concerns about the result of the appeal. 5. CONNECTICUT RESIDENTS (Effective July 1, 2023) Beginning July 1, 2023, under the Connecticut Data Privacy Act, Connecticut residents have additional privacy rights regarding the collections, use and disclosure of their Personal Information. Section I.1(A-G) describes the categories of data, processing purposes, and categories of third parties to whom Personal Information may be disclosed. We do not sell Personal Information of Connecticut residents and we do not process Personal Information for purposes of profiling in furtherance of decisions that produce legal or similarly significant effects. Your Rights to Manage and Control Your Personal Information Beginning July 1, 2023, you have the right to opt out of the processing of your Personal Information for purposes of targeted advertising. The opt out mechanism will be made available as of the effective date. Beginning July 1, 2023, you have the right to request access to or deletion of your Personal Information, or to make corrections to inaccuracies. You can initiate a request for deletion or access by clicking the “Make a Privacy Request” button at the top of this page or by emailing us at Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com . We may verify your identity through email verification or by other methods as appropriate. You can submit requests regarding inaccuracies by emailing Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com . We may limit the disclosure of certain information in an access for your security and safety in accordance with the law and the right to deletion is subject to certain exceptions: for example, we may need to retain certain Personal Information to provide you with the Services or complete a transaction or other action you have requested, or to comply with our legal obligation. You may also authorize an agent (an “Authorized Agent”) to exercise your rights on your behalf. To do this, you must provide your Authorized Agent with written permission to do so, and we may request a copy of this written permission from your Authorized Agent when they make a request to exercise your rights on your behalf. You have the right to appeal a decision to deny processing of a request by emailing Privacy@TeachersPayTeachers.com using the subject line: “DSR Appeal”. X. CHANGES TO THIS POLICY From time to time, we’ll update this Policy in accordance with the process and rules in our Terms of Service . We will alert you to changes by placing a notice on the Site, by sending you an email, and/or by some other means. Please note that if you haven’t provided us with your correct email address, those legal notices will still govern your use of the Services, and you are still responsible for reading and understanding them. If you use the Services after any changes to the Policy have been posted, that means you agree to all of the changes. Use of information we collect is subject to the Policy in effect at the time such information is collected. X.HOW TO REACH US For any questions you have about this Policy, the ways in which we collect and use your Personal Information, or your choices and rights regarding such use, or if you need assistance with your Account, you can reach us anytime using the following methods: Email: Privacy@teacherspayteachers.com Mailing Address: Teacher Synergy LLC: Attention Privacy Team 111 E. 18th Street, Floor 11 New York, NY 10003 You may also find the answer to your question in our FAQs . This Policy was last Updated December 12, 2022, effective January 1, 2023 (See our previous version here ) Our Approach to Privacy Contact Support Return to Main Site

annotations.Text:
SOURCES OF PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT
A. You, For Information You Make Available to Us

Visitors. When you use our Services as a Visitor, we may ask for information about your preferences and interests to personalize your experience and help you find what you need.

All Members. To use many aspects of our Services, you’re required to create a TPT Account and become a Member. To become a Member, we require that you pick a unique username, and provide us with your email address so we can contact you. We may also ask you to tell us your name so we know who you are.

We may ask you to share some information about what kind of user you are (your role), your geographic location, what and where you teach, and information about your interests to help us personalize your experience using our Services. Finally, some features of our Service may allow you to upload, create, record, post or otherwise add and/or share Resources or other content (“Content”) through our platform.

Sellers. Members who register for one of our Seller Memberships (“Sellers”), will be required to provide additional contact information and set up or connect a payout account to receive Earnings. Sellers can choose to use a name other than their given name as a “Store Name.” A Seller’s Store Name, profile image or logo, and any additional information they choose to provide about themselves in their Store profile will be publicly viewable.

To comply with applicable laws, we may collect federal tax identification information from Sellers, including your social security number or employer identification number, to verify your identity and issue tax documents.

Purchase information. When you make a purchase through our Services, you’ll need to provide billing and payment information to complete your order. We’ve carefully chosen Service Providers who use Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) compliant practices to process payments (“Payment Processors”). Whether you check out using a credit or debit card, PayPal account, or any other payment method we may support, your payment will be processed directly by our Payment Processor and we’ll never have access to or store your full payment card details.

When you use a credit or debit card to pay for your purchases, you’ll be asked to add a credit or debit card payment source (“Payment Card”). When you submit your order, this information will be sent directly to and stored by our Payment Processor. After your payment is processed, the Payment Processor will send TPT some details about the transaction so that we can record your order in our database and provide access to the materials that you purchased.

The Payment Card you added will be available for future use on your Account. You can edit or remove this information at any time by navigating to the checkout page or by contacting us for assistance.

B. You, For Information Collected Automatically In Connection With Your Use of Our Services

When you use our Services as a Member or a Visitor, we receive and collect certain information from your browser and your device such as your Internet Protocol address (IP address), device information, operating system, browser type and version, and browser country location. This information helps us defend against fraudulent activity or attacks, maintain the security of our Services, and improve and personalize your experience.

We also log data related to how Members and Visitors use our Services, including Cookies (as defined below) that may uniquely identify your visit or account. This log data includes details such as what pages of our Site or App you visit and when, how users navigate through the Site, and visit referral URLs. This information allows us to better understand how our Services are being used, helps us make improvements, and enables us to personalize your experience with our Services. (Please refer to the Cookies section below for more information about how we use Cookies.)

From time to time, we may host and provide Members and Visitors the opportunity to participate in contests, sweepstakes, and surveys. If you choose to participate, you may be asked to provide Personal Information which may be used for purposes necessary to administer the contest, sweepstakes, or survey, or for other marketing purposes.

C. Third Parties

General. We may collect information about you from third parties as permitted by law or through your interaction with third parties we may integrate with from time to time to offer new features and/or services to you (“Third Party Integrations”). We may also receive information about you from third parties such as other Members in connection with our provision of certain services, including for example TPT School Access or gift cards, as well as from some of our service providers who assist us with marketing or promotional services related to how you interact with our websites, applications, products, services, advertisements or communications.

Integrations. Third Party Integrations may for example, include your use of certain features allowing you to import or export content to or from TPT or linking an account you have with Google or a supported LMS to TPT. TPT may add or remove Third Party Integrations from time to time. Your use of Third Party Integrations is at your discretion and risk and subject to the Third Party Integration’s terms and privacy policies.

Google Drive - Through an integration with Google Drive, you may have the option to list files directly from your Google Drive in your TPT store (“Resources for Google Apps”), or access Resources for Google Apps directly through your Google Drive account (e.g. resources that you have purchased or added to your TPT account for free). To enable your use of this integration, you’ll need to give TPT permission to access your Google Drive for the purposes described in this section. If you’re a Seller listing Resources from your Google Drive, we’ll use this access to list in your TPT store files that you choose from your Google Drive account, set file permissions, make copies for each Member who purchases or accesses your Resources for Google Apps for free, and monitor listed files from your Google Drive for deletions, updates, or changes in permissions so we may be able to alert you or impacted Members. For Members who choose to purchase (or access for free) Resources for Google Apps, we’ll use this access to deliver the Resource to your Google Drive. Use of the integration is subject to Google’s privacy policies — you can find more information about how Google uses your information and what information Google shares with us here.
Learning Management Services - you (or your School) may be able to connect to third party Learning Management Services. See our Student Privacy Policy for more detailed information on what information may be collected or shared when using these integrations.
External Payment Accounts. If you choose to pay for a purchase using an external account like PayPal or ApplePay, you’ll directly access that account to complete your order and when it’s complete, they’ll send us a confirmation with transaction details so we can record your order and provide access to the Resources or services you’ve purchased. We do not collect information about or have access to the specific payment or funding sources or any other financial account details associated with your PayPal, ApplePay or other similar external accounts.

annotations.Text:
HOW WE MAY SHARE PERSONAL INFORMATION
We disclose your Personal Information to the following categories of third parties including service providers, contractors and other parties:

1. Sellers, When You Place an Order
When you place an order on TPT, you’re purchasing from a Seller Member with whom we’ll share order details including what you purchased and your name, city, state, and zip code.

2. The Public or Other Members, When You Connect, Share, or Communicate With Them
There may be features of our Services which allow you to:

Post, create, upload, record or otherwise add Content (e.g. Resources you publish, Communications such as comments, reviews, questions, or other public or private messages, and materials or media created by use of certain features in Easel such as audio or video recordings)
Connect, communicate, and share information with other Members (such as Resource Collections, Member to Member messages, Q&A, and so on)
Join and post messages in forums, groups, or communities
Join or link your account to another Member (e.g. to login as a VA with Support Access), to an Organization using TPT for Schools or TPT School Access (together “School Account”), or other Services that allow similar account connections
Submit requests for Resources or participate in a shared wish list
Display a public profile (e.g. by joining as Seller and having a storefront on TPT), and so on
annotations.Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

annotations.Text:
ervice Providers & Contractors
TPT engages the services of third party companies and contractors (“Service Providers”) to support and help provide certain features of our Services such as, but not limited to, payment processing, hosting, customer support, data storage and analysis, monitoring Site traffic and activity, usability testing and research, error reporting and debugging, communication and content delivery, business operations, advertising, surveys, security and fraud prevention, staff augmentation, and other services. TPT shares data with these Service Providers so that they can perform their services which help deliver our Services more securely, efficiently, and effectively. Service Providers may have access to certain Personal Information in the course of providing their service. Service Providers’ access to your Personal Information is limited to the purpose of providing their services in accordance with an agreement with TPT. Service Providers are not permitted to disclose Personal Information they may process on our behalf to other parties (other than their own service providers as necessary) or use your Personal Information for any other purpose.

TPT may, from time to time, share aggregate or de-identified user data with business partners, Service Providers, or other third parties to identify or share trends, usage statistics, and so on.

annotations.Text:
Third Parties, In Connection With a Merger, Acquisition, or Other Change of Control
As part of a merger, acquisition, bankruptcy or other transaction in which a third party assumes control of our business (in whole or in part), we may transfer the data we have collected, including Personal Information, to the third party. In such an event, we’ll notify you of that change. In addition, any purchasing company would have to abide by the terms of this Policy including notifying you before making material changes and giving you the opportunity to opt out.

5. Third Parties, For Information Requests and Legal Obligations
To the extent you make purchases through the Services using an institution, school, or other third-party entity’s credit or debit card, PayPal account, or any other payment method, and that institution, school, or third party requests such information or information related thereto and TPT, in its sole discretion, determines such request is reasonable, we may choose to provide such information or information related thereto to that institution, school, or third party.

Finally, we respect and comply with legal obligations and may release information (including Personal Information and information about your account activities) in cooperation with a law enforcement investigation, in response to a valid legal request such as a court order, legal subpoena, or government inquiry or audit, as part of the process outlined by the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA), or to defend, protect, or exercise our legal rights.

6. Other Third Parties, At Your Direction.
We may share your Personal Information with other third parties as authorized, directed or requested by you. From time to time, we may provide access to Third Party Integrations or otherwise partner with third party companies or organizations including advertisers to provide additional services, products, and offers (collectively “Partners” and “Partner Services”). When you choose to engage with Partners or use Partner Services, you direct TPT to share Personal Information for the purposes of facilitating your use of the Partner Services and the Partner may collect information from you directly by your interaction. When you choose to engage with Partner Services or authorize TPT to share your Personal Information with a third party other than a Service Provider, you understand that Partners and other such third parties are independent of TPT and this Privacy Policy does not apply to such third party’s collection, use, and sharing practices. You may want to review each such third party’s own privacy notices prior to engaging with them for information on how such third parties will process your information.

annotations.Text:
COOKIES
We use cookies and similar technologies such as pixel tags and web beacons (collectively, “Cookies”) to enable us to recognize your device or browser. Cookies are small pieces of data — usually text files — that are stored in the browser of your computer, tablet, phone, or similar device when you use that device to visit our Services and are used to allow you to pick up where you left off, tailor your experience, surface relevant information, products, and advertisements, and provide us with helpful information to monitor traffic and performance, debug errors, and make improvements. We may also supplement the information we collect from you with information received from third parties, including third parties that have placed their own Cookies on your device(s).

By using our Services as a Visitor or Member, you agree to our use of Cookies in the following ways, as well as other similar purposes:

Analytics
Marketing and advertising
Preserving your preferences
Personalizing your experience
Understanding our website traffic and performance
To ensure the security and availability of our Site and our Services

annotations.Text:
Business Purposes for Disclosing Personal Information

Over the past twelve months, we have disclosed the categories of Personal Information listed in the tables in Section I.1(A-G) above to Service Providers or other parties for the following business purposes:

To perform auditing related to a current interaction and concurrent transactions
To detect security incidents, to protect against malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity, and to prosecute those responsible for that activity
To debug including to identify and repair errors that impair existing intended functionality
To make short-term, transient use of Personal Information that is not used by another party to build a consumer profile or otherwise alter your consumer experience outside the current interaction
To perform services on our behalf, including maintaining or servicing accounts, providing customer service, processing or fulfilling order and transactions, verifying customer information, processing payments, providing advertising or marketing services, providing analytic services, or providing similar services on behalf of the business or service provider
To undertake internal research for technological development and demonstration
To undertake activities to verify or maintain the quality and safety of our Services

We will alert you to changes by placing a notice on the Site, by sending you an email, and/or by some other means. Please note that if you haven’t provided us with your correct email address, those legal notices will still govern your use of the Services, and you are still responsible for reading and understanding them. If you use the Services after any changes to the Policy have been posted, that means you agree to all of the changes. Use of information we collect is subject to the Policy in effect at the time such information is collected.
